dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kaspi.kz just clinched the top spot for e-commerce in Kazakhstan for the sixth year running.

dialogue_turns.text: Sixth year? That's, uh, a serious winning streak. They must be doing something right.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty close! And he emphasized how they support local small businesses too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our merchants, must of whom are local small and medium-sized businesses, we help them reach new customers, grow their businesses and create jobs, commented Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a huge deal. Helping merchants reach new customers and grow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a huge deal. Helping merchants reach new customers and grow.

dialogue_turns.text: The ranking itself is interesting—Forbes Kazakhstan partners with Baker McKenzie for it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB

dialogue_turns.text: Creates jobs, supports the economy… it's more than just an online store, really.

artist_script:
Early morning at the Forbes Kazakhstan headquarters in Almaty.
HostA: Kaspi.kz just clinched the top spot for e-commerce in Kazakhstan for the sixth year running.
HostB: Sixth year? That’s, uh, a serious winning streak. They must be doing something right.
HostA: Absolutely. Their CEO, Michael Lomtadze, mentioned they serve over 11.8 million customers now.
HostB: Wow, 11.8 million—that’s, like, more than half the country’s population, isn’t it?
HostA: Pretty close! And he emphasized how they support local small businesses too.
HostB: Yeah, that’s a huge deal. Helping merchants reach new customers and grow.
HostA: And with almost 2.4 million products available, it’s no wonder they dominate.
HostB: Free delivery probably doesn’t hurt either. That’s a major draw for shoppers.
HostA: The ranking itself is interesting—Forbes Kazakhstan partners with Baker McKenzie for it.
HostB: Oh, the international consulting firm? So it’s a pretty rigorous evaluation.
HostA: Totally. Based purely on online sales revenue, so it’s all about the numbers.
HostB: You know, it’s rare to see such consistent dominance in such a fast-changing industry.
HostA: Right? Especially with e-commerce evolving so quickly everywhere.
HostB: And to think most of their merchants are local SMEs—that’s a cool grassroots angle.
HostA: Creates jobs, supports the economy… it’s more than just an online store, really.
HostB: Definitely feels like a ecosystem they’ve built, not just a platform.
HostA: No wonder they keep topping that list year after year.
